author: pitt
title: Banking the unbanked
description: A truly open financial system can't leave the unbanked and underbanked behind.

assessments.note: There is not enough detail in the proposal to determine if it will address the challenge of helping developers built successful apps

It is not clear what problem the proposal is trying to solve as banking the unbanked is a humongous issue which needs to be worked at in coordination with multiple private and public communities, institutions and governments. Is this problem specifically for Thailand and Myanmar? Providing mobile phone apps is one of the easiest part of this issue.
There is no concrete information to understand how the proposal can address the challenge.

The challenge is interesting and a long term goal for the community. The solution doesn't  seam clear as in defining the implementation that will successfully resolve the challenge posed. More information is required for a proper assessment.
This proposal does not explicitly address the need to improve the developer ecosystem or attract developers to Cardano.

This proposal is posted in the wrong challenge. 
The problem statement is not written in the prescribed format.
The problem statement taken in very broad sense so a focused challenge and specific solution would have been better

I think they have the wrong category. 
This is the Developer ecosystem category and they are talking about creating a banking alternative.

A simple mistake but we cannot consider this as developer ecosystem improvements, sorry.
This does not seem to be a proposal. My apologies. It needs more work explaining the concept further into something that we can correlated with challenge brief more effectively.
Lack of relevant detail related to success metrics and no breakdown of the funds requested make it difficult to assess this as a successful project

There is no mention of private or public sector experience for the proposer relating to working with communities, institutions or government. A plan is needed to properly convey what problem is trying to be solved by this proposal. Voters will very highly not to contact proposer for further details as the problem is vague to begin with.
There is no described plan and it is not possible to assess the relevance of the proposer's experience without understanding what the project intends.

Cultural experience unveils a potential use of the Cardano blockchain but its generic to say what aspect can be used to improve the situation in those regards. More clarity on how to solve the challenge need addressing as well as the plan needed to get there. What are the funds used for? 700,000k on what development and what are the stages of this development needed.
The proposal does not provide evidence of experience with the Cardano blockchain or software engineering expertise.
The proposer's experience seems relevant, but there is no plan included in the proposal. Without a plan, it is impossible to assess if the proposal can be implemented successfully.

Not a lot of detail provided on being able to complete their proposal even if it was in the right category.

Looks like some good high level skills there.
No developer skills noted.
I am going to assume that 700k budget is a typo? But if not - this doesn't really look like an actual proposal. No actual experience showcased or any relevant information on sensible plan.
There is a lack of details around ROI and effectiveness.
No information provided for the requested funding. How can the voters decide if this proposal is worth the funding?
The requested budget goes beyond the amount available in the challenge, so the proposal must be automatically disqualified.
There needs to be more communication of the solution and how it can be successfuly implemented in solving the challenge posed.
The proposal does not provide information to assess the appropriateness of its budget, nor does it propose KPIs or measurable goals.

There is near to no information included in the proposal. 
The asked fund is more than the total for this challenge.
There is a need for proper plan to get something sophisticated done such as the financial system proposed but much light hasn't been provided on it.
This one is off topic for this category and rather generic in proposal goal. It goal is massive, so more detail is needed.
No roadmap, milestones, success metrics, KPIs. I am not sure this is an actual proposal and it is here forgotten by the author and wasn't withdrawn after idea stage? There's not much to work with.

solution: Providing truly open financial system allows people to transfer, save, borrow and investing with nothing more than just a smartphone.
experience: Experienced and engaged in the Thailand and Myanmar governments' MOU to regulate the employment between the 2 countries through technology.
